x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.potential_impact:
Citizens can report damaged trees, track city greening projects, and volunteer for reforestation campaigns. Expected measurable outcomes:

  1. 10% increase in urban tree coverage over 3 years
  2. Better air quality and reduced heat in target areas
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: Urbanization in Nigeria has led to deforestation and loss of green spaces, worsening air quality and urban heat. City councils lack systems to track or maintain trees and parks effectively.
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.project_name: Urban Tree and Park Management Platform
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.solution_proposal:
How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

  1. ServiceNow Public Sector Digital Services (PSDS) for citizen reporting
  2. Field Service Management for maintenance scheduling
  3. Performance Analytics + GIS integration for canopy coverage maps

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

  1. Satellite imagery or GIS data integration
  2. Mobile-friendly citizen reporting interface

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

  1. Data accuracy (citizen-submitted reports)
  2. Coordinating local environmental agencies
  3. Sustaining long-term maintenance funding
